main event: On March 9, 1949, a spherical object was observed in Eau Claire, Wisconsin for approximately 1 hour by a weather officer while traveling in a car.
interesting points: The object's movements ruled out the possibility of it being a planet or celestial phenomenon.
It was estimated to be 10-15 miles laterally from the observer and at an altitude of 20,000 feet.
The object's appearance, color, and size were undetermined.
The observed trail left by the object was intensely white, significantly longer and wider than the object itself.
The object demonstrated maneuvers involving both upward and downward motion with tight maneuvering.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
